questions.question: 1. The output characteristic of an n-p-n transistor represent: [IC= Collector current, VCE= potential difference between collector and emitter, IB=Base current, VBB= voltage given to base; VBE= the potential difference between base and emitter]

answers.a: changes in IC as IB and VBB are changed
answers.b: changes in IC with changes in VCE(IB=constant)
answers.c: changes in IB with changes in VCE
answers.d: changes in IC as VBE is changed

questions.question: 2. In a transistor output characteristics commonly used in common emitter configuration, the base current IB, the collector current IC and the collector-emitter voltage VCE have values of the following orders of magnitude in the active region:

answers.a: IB and IC both are in μA and VCE in volt
answers.b: IB is in μA and IC is in mA and VCE in volt
answers.c: IB is in mA and IC is in μA and VCE in mV
answers.d: IB is in mA and IC is in mA and VCE in mV
